required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: SURGICEL® Powder in Controlling Mild or Moderate Parenchymal or Soft Tissue Intraoperative Bleeding in Adult Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Clinical Study Evaluating the Safety and Haemostatic Effectiveness of SURGICEL® Powder, in Mild or Moderate Parenchymal or Soft Tissue Bleeding During General, Gynaecological, Urological, and Cardiothoracic Surgery

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a prospective, single arm, multicentre, multispecialty, post market, clinical study evaluating SURGICEL Powder as an adjunct to achieve haemostasis (control bleeding) when conventional methods of control are impractical or ineffective during surgery (open, laparoscopic or thoracoscopic) in adult subjects (18 years or older).
After application of SURGICEL Powder, the Target Bleeding Site (TBS) will be assessed for haemostasis (no detectable bleeding) at 3, 5, and 10 minutes from application and prior to initiation of closure.
All enrolled subjects will be followed post-operatively through discharge and again at 30 days and 6 months post-surgery via phone call or office visit.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is an open label, prospective, single arm, multicentre, multispecialty, post-marketing clinical study evaluating SURGICEL Powder as an adjunct to achieve haemostasis in the control of capillary, venous, and small arterial haemorrhage when ligation or other conventional methods of control are impractical or ineffective during surgery (open, laparoscopic or thoracoscopic) in adult subjects (18 years or older). Prospective subjects will be informed about the nature of the research, given the informed consent form (ICF) to read, and, if he/she understands the content, will be asked to provide consent by signing the ICF.
Screening and enrolment will continue until at least 100 evaluable subjects from approximately eight (8) investigational sites, with an appropriate mild or moderate Target Bleeding Site (TBS) are included into the study. The TBS will be the only region evaluated for the primary endpoint and all secondary effectiveness endpoints.
All enrolled subjects will be followed post-operatively through discharge, and via phone call or office visit at 30 days (+14 days) post-surgery. In addition, all enrolled subjects will receive a 6-month (+/-30 days) follow-up phone call or office visit to assess the occurrence of any serious adverse event (SAE) requiring surgical intervention and assessed as possibly related or related to the study treatment.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From application of SURGICEL Powder to 5 minutes after application
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects achieving haemostatic success at 5 minutes following application of SURGICEL Powder with no rebleeding requiring additional treatment at the Target Bleeding Site (TBS) any time prior to initiation of final fascial closure

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From application of SURGICEL Powder to 3 minutes after application
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects achieving haemostatic success at 3 minutes following application of SURGICEL Powder with no rebleeding requiring additional treatment at the TBS any time prior to initiation of final fascial closure

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From application of SURGICEL Powder to 10 minutes after application
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects achieving haemostatic success at 10 minutes following the application of SURGICEL Powder with no rebleeding that requires additional treatment at the TBS any time prior to initiation of final fascial closure

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Experiencing a Thromboembolic Event
other_outcome.time_frame: From application of SURGICEL Powder to 30 day follow-up visit
other_outcome.description: Number of participants experiencing a thromboembolic event that was assessed as having either an unlikely, possible, probable or causal relationship to the study treatment

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Post-operative Re-bleeding
other_outcome.time_frame: From initiation of final fascial closure to the 30-day follow up visit
other_outcome.description: Number of participants of post-operative re-bleeding that was assessed as having either an unlikely, possible, probable or causal relationship to the TBS and requiring medical/surgical intervention

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Experiencing a Serious Adverse Events Requiring Surgical Intervention and Related to SURGICEL Powder
other_outcome.time_frame: From time of SURGICEL Powder application to 6-month follow up visit
other_outcome.description: Number of participants experiencing a serious adverse event requiring surgical intervention and assessed as having either an unlikely, possible, probable or causal relationship to the study treatment

arm_group.description: Single arm clinical trial where all qualified subjects will be treated SURGICEL Powder

intervention.description: SURGICEL Powder is a topical absorbable hemostatic treatment made of oxidized regenerated cellulose (ORC) - plant material

facility.name: Cambridge University Hospitals NHS Trust (Addenbrooke's Hospital)
Leeds Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust (St James's University Hospital)
Newcastle upon Tyne NHS Foundation Trust (Freeman Hospital)

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were screened up to 21 days prior to surgery and attended a baseline visit within 24 hours of surgery. Both visits took place at a clinic within the hospital where surgery also took place. Subjects were followed until hospital discharge and requested to attend a visit at 30 (+14) days post surgery and at 6 months (+/- 30 days) either at the hospital or via telephone.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Subjects required to meet pre-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria prior to receiving study product. Subjects required to have an appropriate mild or moderate target bleeding site (TBS) identified intra-operatively. Subjects excluded if the TBS was where silver nitrate or any other escharotic chemicals were applied, was in, around, or in proximity to foramina in bone, areas of bony confine or where plugging of the urethra, ureter or a catheter was possible by study product.

outcome.title: Haemostatic Success at 5 Minutes
outcome.description: Proportion of subjects achieving haemostatic success at 5 minutes following application of SURGICEL Powder with no rebleeding requiring additional treatment at the Target Bleeding Site (TBS) any time prior to initiation of final fascial closure
outcome.time_frame: From application of SURGICEL Powder to 5 minutes after application
outcome.population: Intent to Treat (All subjects for whom TBS was identified)

measure.title: Haemostatic Success at 5 Minutes
measure.description: Proportion of subjects achieving haemostatic success at 5 minutes following application of SURGICEL Powder with no rebleeding requiring additional treatment at the Target Bleeding Site (TBS) any time prior to initiation of final fascial closure
measure.population: Intent to Treat (All subjects for whom TBS was identified)

outcome.title: Haemostatic Success at 3 Minutes
outcome.description: Proportion of subjects achieving haemostatic success at 3 minutes following application of SURGICEL Powder with no rebleeding requiring additional treatment at the TBS any time prior to initiation of final fascial closure
outcome.time_frame: From application of SURGICEL Powder to 3 minutes after application

measure.title: Haemostatic Success at 3 Minutes
measure.description: Proportion of subjects achieving haemostatic success at 3 minutes following application of SURGICEL Powder with no rebleeding requiring additional treatment at the TBS any time prior to initiation of final fascial closure

outcome.title: Haemostatic Success at 10 Minutes
outcome.description: Proportion of subjects achieving haemostatic success at 10 minutes following the application of SURGICEL Powder with no rebleeding that requires additional treatment at the TBS any time prior to initiation of final fascial closure
outcome.time_frame: From application of SURGICEL Powder to 10 minutes after application

measure.title: Haemostatic Success at 10 Minutes
measure.description: Proportion of subjects achieving haemostatic success at 10 minutes following the application of SURGICEL Powder with no rebleeding that requires additional treatment at the TBS any time prior to initiation of final fascial closure

outcome.title: Number of Participants Experiencing a Thromboembolic Event
outcome.description: Number of participants experiencing a thromboembolic event that was assessed as having either an unlikely, possible, probable or causal relationship to the study treatment
outcome.time_frame: From application of SURGICEL Powder to 30 day follow-up visit

measure.title: Number of Participants Experiencing a Thromboembolic Event
measure.description: Number of participants experiencing a thromboembolic event that was assessed as having either an unlikely, possible, probable or causal relationship to the study treatment

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Post-operative Re-bleeding
outcome.description: Number of participants of post-operative re-bleeding that was assessed as having either an unlikely, possible, probable or causal relationship to the TBS and requiring medical/surgical intervention
outcome.time_frame: From initiation of final fascial closure to the 30-day follow up visit

measure.title: Number of Participants With Post-operative Re-bleeding
measure.description: Number of participants of post-operative re-bleeding that was assessed as having either an unlikely, possible, probable or causal relationship to the TBS and requiring medical/surgical intervention

outcome.title: Number of Participants Experiencing a Serious Adverse Events Requiring Surgical Intervention and Related to SURGICEL Powder
outcome.description: Number of participants experiencing a serious adverse event requiring surgical intervention and assessed as having either an unlikely, possible, probable or causal relationship to the study treatment
outcome.time_frame: From time of SURGICEL Powder application to 6-month follow up visit

measure.title: Number of Participants Experiencing a Serious Adverse Events Requiring Surgical Intervention and Related to SURGICEL Powder
measure.description: Number of participants experiencing a serious adverse event requiring surgical intervention and assessed as having either an unlikely, possible, probable or causal relationship to the study treatment

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected from time product applied to TBS and up to 30 (+14) day follow-up visit. From initiation of final fascial closure to 6-month follow-up visit, SAEs requiring surgical intervention and assessed as having either an unlikely, possible, probable or causal relationship to the study treatment were recorded.
reported_events.desc: For this study, an AE is an untoward medical occurrence (sign, symptom or disease) in a subject and which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with the study medical device. An untoward medical occurrence includes any new, undesirable medical experience or worsening of a pre-existing condition.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Publication based on results shall not be made before the first multi-centre publication. Trust and/or Investigator may prepare data derived from the Clinical Investigation for publication. Sponsor to be given at least 60 days for review. During review period, Sponsor is entitled to request publication be delayed for up to 6 months from date of first submission to Sponsor to enable Sponsor to take steps to protect its proprietary information and/or Intellectual Property Rights and Know How.
